rules: Rule1: If the Health Department approves vaccine distribution, then the disease spread is controlled
Rule2: Either the Health Department approves vaccine distribution or approves antiviral distribution
Rule3: If the outbreak contains alcohol-based solution, then the outbreak escalates to regional spread
Rule4: If the outbreak contains alcohol-based solution, then the outbreak does not escalate to regional spread
Rule5: Either the outbreak contains alcohol-based solution, or if the hospital implements sanitation protocol, then the clinic implements sanitation protocol
Rule6: If the government activates Emergency Plan A, then should the disease spread not be controlled, the community will not maintain normal operations
Rule7: Either the government activates Emergency Plan A or activates Emergency Plan B
Rule8: If the government activates Emergency Plan B, then under the condition that disease spread is not controlled, the community cannot maintain normal operations
Rule9: If the response team deploys mobile testing, then the disease spread is controlled
Rule10: When the response team deploys contact tracing, the disease spread is controlled
Rule11: Provided that logistics secures testing supplies, the response team deploys mobile testing
Rule12: Either logistics secures testing supplies or secures protective equipment
Rule13: If logistics secures protective equipment, then the response team trains for contact tracing
Rule14: When the Health Department approves antiviral distribution, the hospital achieves patient recovery
Rule15: Either the government suspends civil liberties, or if training for contact tracing does not lead to deployment, then the government declares a state of emergency
Rule16: The disease spread is controlled whenever the Health Department establishes a quarantine zone
Rule17: If the Health Department establishes a treatment center, then they establish a quarantine zone
Rule18: Should the Health Department violate medical ethics, then they follow standard protocol
Rule19: If the Health Department violates medical ethics, then they implement experimental treatment
Rule20: Provided that the Health Department implements experimental treatment, the ethics board monitors treatment procedures
Rule21: The Health Department does not follow standard protocol if the ethics board monitors treatment procedures
Rule22: If the lab confirms pathogen identification, then patient recovery at the hospital results in disease spread control
Rule23: Either the lab confirms pathogen identification or the field team confirms outbreak pattern
Rule24: If the research center receives emergency funding, then field team confirmation of outbreak pattern triggers hospital patient recovery leading to disease spread control
Rule25: Either the research center receives emergency funding or the university receives emergency funding
Rule26: When the university receives emergency funding, then field team confirmation of outbreak pattern causes hospital patient recovery to result in disease spread control
Rule27: If training for contact tracing does not result in deployment, then the government does not declare a state of emergency
Rule28: Provided that antiviral approval does not lead to treatment center establishment, the government faces a legal challenge
Rule29: Under the condition that uncontrolled disease spread does not prevent normal community operations, the Health Department violates medical ethics
Rule30: If the disease spread is not controlled, then the community maintains normal operations
Rule31: If disease spread is not controlled, then the hospital implements sanitation protocol
Rule32: If disease spread is not controlled, then the clinic does not implement sanitation protocol
facts: Fact1: The government does not suspend civil liberties
Fact2: The government does not face a legal challenge
